text: Cloudy red pour with a big pinkish colored head. Aroma is full of strawberries. Light bodied. Taste is loaded with strawberry with a hint of tartness on the finish. An amazing aftertaste of strawberry, it really is like just eating fresh strawberries. Lots of lace present. Another outstanding fruit beer from NG. If you told me this was just strawberry juice, Id believe you.

Had this one several times. From 750 ml bomber, on draught at the brewery, several beer festival and now the Thumbprint Series. Pours a hazy deep red amber colored brew with a hot pink head that slowly dissipates and leaves behind some excellent lacing. Aroma of mostly strawberries, golden grain malt, floral hops and a hint of rhubarb. Taste is full bodied, fruity, lots of strawberry and rich golden grain malt and a hint of floral hops. Finish is quite sweet with more strawberry and a hint of rhubarb aftertaste followed by some mild bitterness. Though I detected more strawberry flavors in the Thumbprint Series version compared to the former 750ml bomber, its still an outstanding fruit beer.

big bottle, little bottle, its all good .. . strawberry and fruit juice, and i guess rhubarb .. sweet finish, but not overly so .. this is fruit juice level, good once or twice a year .. . . i found a cigarette butt in one of planters and almost cried..

Thanks Virby44 for sharing the bottle! Poured into a wineglass showing cloudy lightly filtered strawberry with very sparse foam white lacing and translucent rims. 

The nose shows jammy rich strawberries. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Moderately sweet with jammy flavors of strawberry from start to finish lightly supported by rhubarb. NG does make the best fruit beers.

12 oz bottle. Smells like strawberry rhubarb pie, complete with baked crust, and a really good pie at that. The taste doesnt disappoint, instead living up to the promise of the aroma. 
Excellent smooth body with perfect carbonation. 
Overall: Super. A new favorite for me from New Glarus?
Bottle thanks to Dita. Pours cloudy red with a pink head. Strawberry Jell-O nose. Medium mouthfeel. Clawingly sweet.

Original 11/13 rating; Ar - 7 Ap - 4 Fl - 8 P - 4 O - 16 Rate 3.9. 2017 rerate: Pulpy, hazed rusty blood color along with a pink/tan head. Strawberries and pale malt mingle in the aromas along with a hint of stomach acid. I seem to be catching some other fruits as well, such as tart cherries and a few other berries. Light sweet start that is quickly whisk away by tart rhubarb that is quite similar to tart cherries. Very light on the palate, which along with the tartness leaves the mouth watering. Seem to have a grainy finish this time around.
12oz bottle shared. Dark cloudy ruby red pour. Huge fruit aroma. Taste like fresh strawberries and rhubarb. So juicy and delicious. They nailed it.
aroma is just spectacular. strawberries galore. flavor is not too sweet, strong strawberry flavors. just refreshing and crushable. pours reddish pink somewhat clear. best fruit beer i have ever had.

small tan head with a fair retention and a stringy lace. Looks like a glass of muddy water, one ugly sumbitch. Lotsa strawberry in the aroma and flavor dept. Medium bodied, little crunchy. Rhubarb is noticeable in an earthy, slightly vegetal way and actually helps pound the sweetness of this beer down a skoche i do believe, thank Gambrinus! Otherwise a sweet, strawberry, ugly ass beer. Not sure how it rates this high or if its the age killing it or maybe a lot of you folks just like sweet fruity beers like the kiddies do. Got me. Anyways, props to MOTORTODDHEAD for the bottle that was delivered in a trade many , many moons ago. Thanks bro, love ya!

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is fruity with a rhubarb and strawberry character. Moderately strong syrupy, honey notes with a touch of a wet cardboard character. More rhubarb than strawberry with a faint phenolic note. 
Pours a murky, light brown color with a bit of a tan hue and a medium sized, fairly thick, tan head that slowly recedes to thin film that lingers on the edges. Light lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is very sweet with some moderate honey, caramel and syrup notes. Moderate rhubarb notes with some lighter strawberry character. Some light phenolic notes. A touch of wet cardboard notes. Low bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, the age hasnt helped this beer, but I am not sure it was very good in the first place. The beer is very sweet with some moderate fruit notes. Moderate oxidation and sweet malt notes.

At Hopishops B.U.M.B. 2016, shared by 77ships, cheers! Lightly lacing, egg-white, moussy head, lightly hazy orangey blonde robe with warm amberish hue. Aroma breathes a ton of ripe, sweet strawberries, home made strawberry jam, rhubarb stewed with lots of white sugar to soften the tartness like my grandmother used to do, more subtle notes of marmelade, apple cake, vanilla, banana and white bread lurking underneath. Very emphatic sweet strawberry flavor and though sugary, still feeling natural, not cloying as in an industrial sweet fruit beer; the sourish rhubarb flavor sits underneath but its hard to spot and could have been more outspoken if only to provide balance against the sweetness. Medium carbo (could have been a bit fizzier for such a sweet dessert beer, to my taste at least), some soapy wheatiness and soft, fluffy breadiness provide an underlying structure that carries the artisanal strawberry jam sweetness onwards. Slight earthiness in the very end, with the sweetness sticking a little bit to the throat. Like many of these New Glarus fruit beers apparently, this is very sweet, but in an elegant, refined kind of way - comparing this and the others with cheap industrial sweet fruit beers would be a lot like comparing grandmothers sweet strawberry cake with sticky, plasticy, industrial strawberry-flavored candy. It know which of those two I would prefer.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of strawberry jam and candy. Flavor has sweet syrupy strawberry and candy jam. These New Glarus beers are a bit of a letdown.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ HopisHop B.U.M.B. 2016. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Nose is hilariously heavy on sweet strawberry jam, quite awesome, stupid sweet as usual for a New Glarus fruit beer, pure strawberry jam really. Taste is bit empty especially compared to the smell, bit metallic upfront, sparkling water, strawberry jam, some faint lemon way in the back, bit empty tasting. Body is lightly metallic strawberry jam diluted with sparkling water. If only it tasted like it smelled. I have no idea where the Rhubarb is.

A: Very cloudy red/brownish coloured with a big off white/pinkish head N: Strawberry! Hint of raspberry and red currant. T: Strawberry bomb! Light rhubarb as well. O: Very much strawberry and a small hubt of sweet rhubarb. VERY well balanced flavours! Perfect carbonation. Super nice!

Three bottles consumed over 2013-late 2015. Usually I had this in a NG flute; I think its good to start it out fairly cold, especially if youre going to do the whole bottle by yourself (which I did with 2 of them) over an evening. It poured a murky brick-red to muddy brown, with plenty of fizzy head that died off fairly quickly...nose is, as expected, strawberry-rhubard, duh! But of course as with other NG fruit beers, its so fresh, so bold, so aromatic that the whole room lights up and I cant do anything but keep smelling, keep nosing, keep loving...its a bit less sweet on both the nose and tongue than the Belgian Red generally is, Id say, but perhaps more sweet than the Raspberry Tart or Serendipity, but what really stands out special about this one in comparison to the other masterpieces is the malt extraction, this has a fullness and biscuit-pie crust malt that provides a fuller and less acidic body than Im used to, making it simultaneously more quaffable at once in a glass or two, but a bit tougher to consume when talking the whole bottle. Theres also snatches of vanilla and caramel in here, and a hint of lime. I probably liked this more than the bottles Ive had of Serendipity, though I had that on draught once and it was otherworldly; as it is, its just another "typically" great experience from the American master of fruit beers. Im sorry to say it looks as if this might be gone for good; its listed as such on the website, and the clerk at the brewery a couple of weeks ago told me he didnt think it was coming back. But one never knows - the Apple Ale was out of circulation for a few years at one point. Bring it back, Dan!
Bottle. Pours murky pinkish brown with medium light pinkish brown head which quickly recedes. Aroma is loaded with strawberries. Taste is strawberry sweet, slight rhubarb tart, a hint of sweet sugar.

Small yellowish head over fully hazy red-brown beer. Strawberry ice-cream, milky, even a bit vomit-like smell. Milky, lactic, again strawberry ice cream, if watered-down. Medium bodied, quite slick. Another NG fruit I really cant like.

older bottle had plenty of sediment as well. the pour was cloudy reddish mess really. guessing it was past its prime but none the less. the most delicious of the fruit beers that I have tasted. pure strawberry and rhubarb flavor. just totally delicious and since its not being made anymore ill never see it again. but this was just one fantastic beer. thanks shrubber for this one. I still owe you

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 could never imagine a "strawberry jam" beer would taste like this one...quite a pleasant surprise to have tasted a beer that is essentially a fruit beer but did more than just fruits. the freshness, light sweet sour of strawberry after fermentation just came together nicely---if you ever see this beer--grab it--or throw me a line...:) 草莓大黄酿制
Taste pour at my birthday party 12/6. Nice amount of strawberry, lightly tart. New Glarus never fails.

"The greatest slice of strawberry rhubarb pie ever served. In a glass." Those were the notes I entered into my phone on the night I tasted Strawberry Rhubarb. While I want to provide a few more details, I feel that statement captures the essence of this brew about perfectly. Appearance is totally unimpressive: hazy (almost muddy) with just a little head. Thats the only knock - if you can call it that - against this beer. Smells and flavors are unreal. Juicy, lightly tart fruit with a hint of malt. Feel is lively and smooth. My first New Glarus brew and it sure as hell wont be my last.

(Thanks, Josh! "StFun")

Bottle.

A- Strawberry puree, rhubarb, slightly sweet.

A- Brown color, murky liquid, off brown head.

T- Rhubarb, strawberry. 

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, long beautiful finish.

O- When I first got into craft I loved fruit beers, with all the sweetness and artificial fruit flavors. Then I learned that they actually really sucked. Now, this beer came across my path. Holy moly. This smelled like my grandmas award winning strawberry rhubarb pie. The nose translates into the palate. Very natural tasting and balanced. Not tart, not bitter, but just right. Wow. I cant say enough good things. The only bad thing is it looked like dirty sewage water. That hurt it overall a little, but otherwise this is as good as you will find for not only a fruit beer but a beer in general.

Caramel colour, white head. Aroma of strawberry jam, loads of sweet strawberry jam. Sweet flavour, strawberries, jam, strawberry yoghurt drink, only a hint of rhubarb. Finish sweet strawberry joghurt.(from 75cL bottle @ Lets drink all of Richs American beers Tasting. Thanks for sharing, omgrich!)
Bottle at freriks place. This is almost like a lemonade, but in a good way. Lots of berries in there with rhubarb and strawberries.

bottle. deep amber brown with one finger head. huge strawberry. initially quite sweet, but finishes more on the tart side. as with most of new glarus fruit beers, its ridiculous how much fruit flavor is packed in this beer.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange reddish color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy weak tart strawberry rhubarb aroma. Fruity spicy sweetish strawberry flavor with hints of tart rhubarb. Has a fruity sweetish strawberry and rhubarb finish with some weak tart hints.
Light ruby pour. This beer features heavy rhubarb notes but also an extrenely hefty tart-ness that doesnt help the palatr at all. Still, NG knows how to do fruit beers.

Served in a flute to celebrate St-Jean-Baptiste Day with some cherry pie. Its definitely not such a great looking beer pouring a muddy bronze color. The nose on the other hand is fantastic strawberry jam and rhubarb. Wow, this is great. First hit sweet strawberries, then jam, rhubarb, a tartness and acidity. Incredibly light bodied with a sparkling water type of carbonation. A stunningly well made fruit beer that doesnt get too sweet.

Muddy brown with a small off white head. Big nose of rhubarb, but tastes of strawberries. A bit fizzy like a soda pop, Paired well with some Humboldt fog and Brie cheeses. Jammed to Alan Parsons the Raven while rating.
6/3/15: 750 ml. bottle. Murky brown color with a medium head. Would have expected it a bit more red, but the strawberry aroma is there. Sweet, light tartness and very refreshing. Great summer beer.
Bottle. Hazy amberr beer with an offwhite head. Huge strawberry aroma, caramell and vanilla notes. Strawberry, caramell and rhubarb flavour with some earthy notes.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange copper with large frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong strawberry cake, floral, wheat. Medium mouth with strong strawberry cream, tart, lingering sweetness, very nice.

Bottle. Murky maroon, the color and shininess of a decade-old penny. Some floaters are visible throughout; a pillowy, tan head leaves beautiful spotted lace. Sweet aroma. Tons of squeezed strawberries, a hint of earthy rhubarb. There isnt much else to it, but not much else is necessary. Theres better balance between the two main ingredients in the flavor. which is a perfect blend of tart rhubarb and sweet strawberry. Slight acidity, with a flash of tartness at the finish. Medium-light body, low carbonation. Juice-like in feel and flavor, this brew is just what it purports to be: strawberry, rhubarb and alcohol.
Strawberry intensity in the aroma. Some tartness in the overwhelming delicious strawberry flavor. Some light sweet malts in the finish.
Aroma of strawberry, taste is strawberry, lots of strawberry, fresh, no alcohol, amazing beer-taste at DLD 2015.

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing this bottle!  Nice fruity strawberry nose. The beer starts fruity. Lots of fresh fruits inside. The beer in the background is slightly sourish, but the fruitiness is on top. Quite sweetish, nice strawberry-candy-flavour. A bit sweetish, but round and great!

Pours avreddish amber color with a tan head. The smell is strawberry, jam, a bit of bitterness coming off the rhubarb. The taste is strawberry candy, nice tartness, simply full of flavor. Light/medium in flavor with beautiful carbonation. Wow!

Bottle, shared by myself, in a location remote of my dining room.
Pours a very hazy pinkish color with a decent head & some lacing on the glass.

The aroma has lots of ripe strawberry, maybe some dandelion greens, some light funk, but mostly its bright wonderful strawberry. 

The flavor is tart with lots of ripe rhubarb, a little woodiness, and a great strawberry character. Its sweet, but not overwhelmingly so. Its totally balanced with extraordinarily focused flavors that allow room for some complexity to go on in the background. 

Extraordinary fruit beer on all accounts.
Bomber (Thanks Tom) to tulip. Pours a clear brownish red with a thin khaki colored head. Aroma is strawberries. Taste is strawberry and tart rhubarb. Very very sweet.

Murky cooper pour with thin bubbly head. Smells amazing. Sweet, crisp, sweetness, not overly tart. Not a fruity beer fan, but this is really good. Would love to have a bottle in the summer.

Strawberry jam nose. Taste is jam on toast with a little extra bready sweetness. Light acidity leads to lingering fresh strawberry.
Bottle. Color is murky rusty pink with gorgeous white head. Strawberry aroma and some tart wheat. Taste is simply gorgeous berry lively and bubbly.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy ruby brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is fresh strawberry jam, bready malts, and faint floral notes. Flavor is huge strawberry presence but blended so well with the malt profile and a touch of oak. Medium body and light carbonation.
Bottle..Pour is red with bubbles. .Taste is strawberry, rhubarb, sweet, fruit, amazingness..Taste is fruit, sherbert, sweet, strawberry, rhubarb, amazingness
Just so sweet. It smells amazing, a very interesting appearance as well. After drinking ipa all day, this is really sweet.

Pours a super murky orangish beige with off white head. Insane strawberry rhubarb aroma. Smells like fresh jam. Flavor is also intensely strawberry and rhubarb with mild sour notes to offset the sweetness. Incredibly easy to drink. This is my first New Glarus fruit beer and I can now appreciate all the hype. Excellent fruit beer.

Pours a muddy reddish copper with a light tan head and good lacing. Aroma of strawberries and cream, strawberry soda and mild root vegetable. Taste is slightly tart and sweet with strawberry, cream and root vegetable flavor. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium body and moderate/high carbonation. Nice combination of fruit flavor with the tart and sweet taste. Might be my favorite of their large format fruit beers.

2014 bottle. Pours a very hazy yellow/brown copper. Aroma is strawberries and cream with something else that I assume is the rhubarb. Taste is a slightly bitter creamy strawberry. Creamy mouthfeel.

A brownish ruby color with two finger of cream colored head. Smell is very strong strawberry jolly rancher, some watermelon. Taste is a slightly tart but also sweet strawberry, a little vanilla cream. Some caramel malt sweetness at the end. Enjoyable, refreshing fruit beer.

Reddish brown pour with aroma just like the strawberry-rhubarb jelly my parents used to make. Strawberry-rhubarb flavor with hint of sourness. Great beer! Thanks to richlike beer.

Poured from 750 to glass. Murky, muddy brownish hue with creamy off white head. Aroma is fruity strawberry, straw, sugar, slight acid. Mouthfeel is great with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a tart following. Overall this is one of the better strawberry brews that Ive had.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 750 mL bottle supplied by Stine - many thanks! Split three ways, and served at 51°. To  semi-clean (kidding: was quite clean) oversized snifter, it pours a burnt carrot orange with which a snowy white head 1 finger in length stood. Murky. Aromas of strawberry rhubarb pie, Virgils Peach Lemonade, light candi sugar, fresh mint, kiwifruit, black limes, seaweed, minerals, unripe cranberries, and papaya. Tastes the with the addition of mashed banana, caramel apples, and American yeast. Ridiculously fruity. Love this. And I knew I would. New Glarus knows how fruit beers are supposed to taste. I could easily drink five of these in under an hour.

750 ml bottle shared by Radarsock, much thanks on this Andrew!! Dark hazy brown color thin head, low retention. Holy hell that is a shit ton of strawberry! Aroma is bursting with smashed strawberry and weak soured rhubarb. Damn I Inhaled the aroma for a good 2 minutes before I even sipped it. 
Flavor is just as luscious as the aroma. Abundant amount of strawberries with very mild tartness in the finish. The flavor is off the wall good for a 4 % brew. Just crazy juicy strawberries and the mild rhubarb is so nice to balance the berry sweetness, just great tasting.

Bottle shared by Radarsock, thanks Andrew! Pours oxidized strawberry brown with a white head. Aroma is straight up strawberry, like opened by a container of tart frozen strawberries. Taste is delicious, backbone is russet apple, with lots of natural strawberry, seeds and all, on top.

[6058-20131115] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Strawberry fruit jam aroma is strong and beautiful. Hazy, brown amber body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Super strawberry flavour and seeds has a ton of fruity notes and finishes like a Yop. Medium body is fruity tart, "not Cantillon tart". Delicious!! (10/4/9/4/17) 4.4
(c/o JoeMcPhee)
750ml bottle pours a reddy brown color with a bit of frothy head. Amazing ripe strawberry flavor. The rhubarb adds nicely to it to fill out the flavor. Slight fruit tartness.
1pt 9fl oz bottle poured into a shaker. Dark orange with a lively off-white head. Aroma is strawberry. Flavor is the same but quite sour. Finishes sweet.
Murky reddish brown pour. Small tan head. Little lacing. Big aroma of strawberry. Some notes of rhubarb and sugar. Pie crust flavor with a big rhubarb taste. Slight sweetness.

Bottle. Colour...cloudy amber with a thin white head. Nose...a big brimming bowl of strawberry-rhubarb compote! Palate...very strawberry-rhubarb-y to start, but then it dissipates rapidly and theres a bit of metal at the back of the palate. Still, a dandy when its quite cold!

Bottle at Craigs. Thanks Dinah and Max. Pours hazy amber with a thin white. Aromas of jam, strawberry, yoghurt lactic thing, funk, rhubarb. Taste is light sweet, bready, sour, red fruit. Lovely stuff.
Bottle at Craigs, amazing jammy strawberry...the most outstanding beer of the evening...so succinct and tight.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy amber, nose is strawberry yoghurt, rhubarb crumble, taste is huge strawberry, sweet, tart, rhubarb, fantastic.

bottle at home ... dark copper .. .ligth hazy ... small tan head ... soft sweet fruit ... soft funk...light sweet strawberry ... light rhubarb... soft fruit nose .... juicy oily fruits .. massive rhubarb .. even more massive straewberry jam ... sofyt seet fruits ... juicy fruits ... light rhubarb massivve strawberry.. wow.. this is what New Glarus Excel at.. It Just WOW
Bottle thanks to Dina and Max. Amber with off white head. Aroma of strawberry, some sweat. Taste of strawberry jam. Not very sweet, long finish. Nice but more fruit than beer.

Little hazy, pronounced nose of strawberries, with sour notes. One of the best sours I tried

Great fruit beer but it actually tastes Ike beer and not a wine cooler. Not too sweet like many fruit beers I've tried.

How: Bottle.
Where: From a trade with _angst_.
Appearance: Dark golden colour with a small off-white head.
Aroma: Strawberry, caramel, fruit, rhubarb.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Strawberry, rhubarb, caramel, fruit.

Pours slightly hazy amber hue with a soapy eggshell head with good lacing from the start. nose is lots of stawbeery. not much else on the nose maybe a hit of that rhubarb, but not much at all. the strawberry is pretty over the top here. good beer from them overall however their must non-interesting of their fruit beers they have done so far. With that said, this runs circles around most breweries fruit beers every time of the day.

Muddy, unattractive pour. Nose is a perfect recreation of strawberry rhubarb pie. Flavor does a great job of mimicking the dessert as well but unfortunately is cloyingly sweet and doesnt have enough acid to cut through the sweetness.

WOW! What a delicious beer courtesy of Lithy. Delicious strong aroma of pink Starburst and not much else. Pour was a beautiful medium hazy brown with a light pink hue. Taste was out of this world. Strong strawberry jam flavor with nothing else getting in the way. I have no idea what rhubarb tastes like but if it doesnt taste like strawberry I didnt taste it. Nice carbonation round this masterpiece out. Makes me want to move to Wisconsin!

text: Bottle at Jester King Zwanze Day. Brown pour with a white head. The aroma has some huge strawberry notes as well as a hint of earth. The flavor is more of the same. I get some big strawberry jam, as well as a hint of rhubarb. There is also a little bit of tartness in there that really makes things come together nicely. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Another great fruit beer from New Glarus.

750ml bottle Hazy dingy pink Wispy off white head. Huge slight sour strawberries. Tart slightly funky rhubarb and strawberry flavors. Late sour funky trailer. A definite cousin to the Belgian Red and their Raspberry Tart.
Bottle: Reddish brown with a cream color head. Amazing smell of homemade strawberry jam. A virtual liquid fruit roll-up. You can detect a little bit of the sour in there as well. AMAZING!!!!!

Bottle. Pour is cloudy copper with a hint of red and a medium white head. Aroma really is loaded with strawberry and rhubarb. Not much else in the aroma. Flavor is tart up front followed by fruity strawberry and rhubarb. This delivers on what it promises. The flavor is so fruity that it tastes artificial. Not sure I love it, but its true to its name.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 Bottle thanks to trade with jdb288! Pours a murky brown with bubbly tan head that dissipates quickly to leave light lace. Aroma is straight up strawberry, amazingly fresh nose. Taste follows with a hint of earth on the back end, a hint of tartness but very mild. Good stuff, I wonder if it ages to become more sour.

Pour murky brownish caramel color with a small but lasting beige head.Faint strawberry/ yeasty/ funky aroma with a nice strawberry flavor and a slight vegetable touch. Not as intense as other New Glarus beers in terms of acidity/ flavor. Medium to light palate, refreshing and very easy to drink. Guess I like the other fruit beer from them better... But even though this is a bit blander, it kind of grows on you and you start to get more flavors. Could see myself grilling in the summer with this one.

Cloudy brownish color out of the bottle with a nose that does remind me of a strawberry rhubarb pie. Nice natural strawberry flavor with some rhubarb custard and pie crust notes. Just enough tartness to reference the fruit without being sour. Another very nice fruit beer from New Glarus.
Bottle. Great brew. Well balance of sweet and tart. Refreshing and light but full of flavor.

Cloudy reddish pour from 22oz bottle at the lake. Wow. Where to start. Aroma is strawberry Carmel sweetness. Crazy smell like a pile of fruits. Tart malty and syrupy strawberry taste. Just too much wine cooler for me.

Poured from bottle into fluted glass. Opaque reddish-brownish color with fizzy off-white head that dissipates completely over time. Smells like a jar of strawberry jam. Taste has some strawberry and rhubarb (of course), with plenty of tart-ness. Feel is a bit fizzy. Overall, a pretty tasty fruit brew. I like some of the others better, though.

Courtesy of Todd! Man, this stuff looks like caramel in a glass, its awesome looking, with fine lacing bubbles to round it out. Funky/stewed berries and rhubarb, light caramel sweetness, comforting dessert in a glass. Biting on the tongue, theres a spicy tang throughout with mellow/fruity sweetness to even things out. As it warms notes of fresh strawberry in the aroma, a little bit of greenery as well. Creamy with a spikey carbonation makes for a playful experience, finishes with a very pleasant fruity/berry note that dries out quickly giving way to toast/wood that lingers. Very NG in execution, would be hard to mistake for another brewer though feels a little less serious than some of the others Ive had from them recently... a bit less focused and more fun. Couldnt ask for a better end of summer evening brew.
Bomber bottle. Pours reddish brown, slight head. Aromas sweet strawberry and sour. Taste is sweet strawberry, bit of rhubarb at the back. A fruit beer for summer.
Yum! Strawberry-rhubarb pie is probably my favorite pie...so this beer had to be a slam dunk. And it was - tart and sweet at the same time, just like the pie filling youd expect. Great beer.

A reddish, brownish mystery color, with a big head that disappears fast. Fantastic strawberry aromas, as well as some mild malt. Strawberry is strong and obvious but its well restrained. Sugary sweet, rhubarb is a nice bitter balance. Just amazing

Cloudy, orange-gold, some redness. Light tan head. Huge sweet strawberry nose, candy. Initially sweet, then turns quite sour, pretty dry finish for as sweet as it starts. Finish is pretty long, quite a lot of carbonation as well as acidity. Very well balanced, very interesting. Awesome beer.

Smells like strawberries. Medium fizzy carbonation. Very slightly foamy. Taste is both sweet and tart strawberry along with some sort of vegetable taste which I assume is rhubarb (Ive never had rhubarb). Aftertaste is less than 10 seconds and the same.

Bottle to glass. Pours a slight hazy deep amber color with a light peach colored head. Aroma is apple cider, light strawberries, sweet. Flavor brings out much more of the strawberry character. Quite sweet. Mild tartness. Strong lingering fruity sweetness in the finish. Delicious and refreshing!

On draught at the brewery. Pours a murky brownish-amber color with a medium creamy light beige head that diminishes slowly. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of strawberries and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of strawberries, tart rhubarb and caramel malt. The finish is fruity with a lingering strawberry aftertaste. Enjoyable all around.

Pour is a murky copper with some ruby edges and a tight tan head. Nose is earthy up front, root notes, strong strawberry fruit rollup comes in behind. Taste is more clean strawberry jam with a faint earthiness to balance. Really soft body and fairly assertive carbonation with a semi dry finish. Strawberry Rhubarb 
New Glarus Brewing 
Fruit beer
4% ABV 

APPEARANCE: Poured a murky, muddy brown color. Very slight reddish/pink variations around the rim and sides of the glass. With the smallest halo of a head that just kinda lazily dissipated into nothingness. 

AROMA: As I was pouring the smell of fresh made strawberry jam came rushing up at me. I got my nose in it and it literally smells like pie, you get the internees strawberry with nice hints of rhubarb. Then the malty pie crust comes through. This is one of the most intense bouquets I've had on a beer in a while. 

TASTE: Like little tiny Keebler elves are baking a fresh pie in my mouth! That jammy, sweet strawberry is undeniable. Nice bit of tartness from the rhubarb, then those sweet malty aromas I got come in with a good balance. This beer taste so fresh and juicy, it is sweet but not overly or artifice sweet. 

MOUTHFEEL: Light body with a medium prickly carbonation. Slightly sticky mouthfeel I'm assuming from all the sugars in the fruit. There is a slight creaminess that really makes it drink nicely. 

OVERALL: This was such a treat to drink, really enjoyed it. The only thing that kinda threw me off was the odd murky color but that's really just nit picking. I'm excited to get into the rest of the new glarus line up and see how they stack up against each other. I really do feel that new glarus is on top of the fruit beer world. 

RATING: 4.2/5 Zombie Heads!

Majority pour from "1 Pint 9 Fl. Oz." (presumably 750 mL) bottle, consumed on 5-1-14. I must have had this beer in my beer fridge for 4 to 8 months. Tart, yeasty aroma features scents of strawberry (a very heavy scent, in fact), caramel, and milk chocolate. The smell is mostly nice, but it is simple, and Im not sure strawberry is the right fit for a beer (whereas cherry and raspberry work quite well). I dont explicitly get rhubarb in the aroma. Cloudy, hazy, opaque liquid is tan / light brown in color. Small to moderate amount of short-lasting beige head. Pleasing, unusual look. Tart flavor features lemon and caramel elements. Sweetness from the strawberry, but it is a generic fruit sweetness, not necessarily explicitly strawberry in flavor. Bread / muffin / bagel flavors. Unexpectedly an English-style barleywine-like or pumpkin beer effect. Again, in the flavor, I dont specifically get rhubarb, but I certainly get tartness that could originate from the rhubarb. I love the tartness. Im less keen on the sweetness. Astringency at the back of the tongue. Acidic bite in the palate. Lively, smooth, and oily. Full bodied and filling. Strawberry Rhubarb is not as amazing as Belgian Red, Raspberry Tart, or Serendipity, largely because strawberry as a fruit simply doesnt work particularly well as a brewing ingredient, but the beer is nonetheless quite tasty, enjoyable, and interesting.

Iced tea appearance, white head, but fades quickly and not a lot of lacing. Vibrant sweet strawberry aroma, more strawberries than rhubarb in the aroma. Taste is nice and sweet with a touch of tartness from the rhubarb, tastes a bit like dough and pectin, and the finish is a bit weak. Palate is pretty middling. Again, I find these New Glarus fruit beers to be marvellous at first but the flavour fades away quite quickly, I guess that might be called a watery finish. Still tastes greatat first. Nice beer overall.

Pours a hazy ruby color, with a thin white head, fading quickly to fine lacing. Smells of strawberry jam, ready for some toast! Has a great initial tartness, some earthy undertones, thickness in the mouthfeel lets the strawberry jam slide into the back end. Delicious! Mildly acidic and very drinkable. Dangerously good. On par with the other fine New Glarus fruit beers.
Brownish purple in color. Fruity, sour, kind of soapy smell. Nice sweet taste. Tartness from the strawberries, but still sweet. This is good, but the cherry one us better.

24/XII/13 - 75cl bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: n/a (2013-1172) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy copper coloured beer, small aery off-white big bubbled head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, strawberry jam, yoghurt, cow stable, strawberry candy, little dirty (say funky if you want a euphemism). MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of strawberry yoghurt, pretty sweet and sugary, little citric acidity. Aftertaste: lots of rhubarb jam and strawberry jam, strawberry yoghurt, sugary and sweet with a nice citric ending. Well, it tasted like real fruit, even if its cooked real fruit. But its too sweet and sugary for my liking. The citric acidity in the end cuts a little through that, so youre not left with a cloying sugary mouth feeling, but thats not enough for me. I prefer real fruity tartness.

A - pours a murky reddish brown with 2 finger fluffy white head that disappeared quickly. S - wow. This smells like a strawberry rhubarb pie (or those little strawberry Bon Bon candies). This is a dessert beer! Musty damn fruity and sweet. M - medium sticky sweet body. Drinkable and good. T - musty and overly sweet muddled strawberry and rhubarb. Honey and floral notes as well. O - very good. Amazing fruit beer. 4.0

Pours an unassuming murky/dirty rreddihs brown with one to two fingers of dense and fluffy head that settles nicely.back into itself. Absolutely amazing nose. Incredibly intense strawberry character that borders on fresh jam. Ephemeral berry sweetness and light tartness with a touch of earthy notes Very light berry sweetness in the flavor with a bit more acidity than the nose lets on. Light bodied and tart with a dry finish.
750ml bottle-offwhite-hazy orange/amber. A-strawberry, lt malt-bready. T-strawberry, some tart rhubarb, sweet lt malt. Enjoyable!

Bottle. Murky brown liquid with small white head. Aroma of strawberries, raspberries, sugar, rhubarb, citric acid and toffee. Taste is medium sweet and light sour with notes of strawberries, rhubarb, toffee and sugar. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice but almost too much.
Bottle. Cloudy orange amber, thin tan head. Aroma is fresh strawberry, light herbal and rhubarb. Taste is strawberry and toasty malt, slight citrus and herbal. It is light sour with light sparkling.

750 mL waxed bottle crushed with the fam post-feast. Pours cloudy light ruby, almost pink with very little head. Huge rush of strawberry on the nose, with some sour notes that complement very nicely. Wonderful prickly mouthfeel. Liquid strawberry with terrific tartness. About as good as it gets.

I love the flavor concept, and rhubarb is one of my very favorite foods, but I would assert that the high average rating for this beer reflects the great reputation of New Glarus, and especially its wonderful cherry and raspberry beers. In this case, the strawberry aroma is excellent and the flavor has some complexity, but not enough, especially in the rhubarb department. Nor is the tartness as vibrant as I hoped for in a wildly fermented beer. Good, but not great. A good Christmas Eve treat, all the same. Bottle.

Bottle from DrewFace... Thanks sucker. Aroma is all strawberries. Pours pour red/orange with small white head. Taste is also all strawberries. Really like it, would be much on your own, but it is really nice.

Pours a cloudy reddish orange color. Big strawberry aroma, light tartness. Huge strawberry flavor too, real strawberries, light creamy type character, tartness in the back. Sweet overall but a tasty fruit beer.

Aroma: Musty Strawberries, Bready Malts, Pears

Appearance: Murky Orange/Brownish Hue, Passes Mild Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Tart Strawberries, Rhubarb, Mild Plums, Mild Cherry, Mildly Acidic

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Sweet

Bottle shared with Dad for the holidays. Pours a slightly murky brown with some red hues and a brownish off white head. Smell is big time fresh strawberries and some tart rhubarb. Flavor follows with up front sweet strawberry followed by a tinge of malts and a tad of sour rhubarb to finish. Light mouthfeel with high carbonation makes this super easy to put down the gullet. I was worries I wouldn't like this as other strawberry drinks have not been up my alley. But as usual New Glarus hit it on the nose with another fruit beer. Very nicely done. This was a hit all around.

Bomber. Ruby brown pour with off white head. Some retention. Nose mainly of fresh strawberries maybe slight lemon. Taste is full of strawberries, and other fruit. Slight vegetable flavor as well. Very mild acidity and finish more on the sweet side than dry. Pretty cool.

Whoa, amazing beer via trade with Homer321! The 75cl bottle pours with a murky chalky paper like copper body that supports a light tan head. The aroma offers up earthy fruity goodness, fresh cut strawberries and some sweet sugary malts binding everything together. The taste is straight up fresh yummy strawberry running into smooth malts and earthy malt nuanced berry fruitiness. Nice stuff. Oh man. Wonderful. I need more of this.

Purchased at Steves Wines in Madison, WI; enjoyed while watching Robocop with friends after a video shoot in Milwaukee, WI. This stuff is awesome. Appearance is a cloudy mixture of dark brown / ruby with a rich white, frothy head with nice lacing. Aroma is rich, very sweet with a great strawberry profile, smell is very fresh, like a nice purée. Taste is fantastic, goes down sweet but not especially tart, Im wondering if the rhubarb helps to balance that out. Very happy I was able to have this one.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a white wine glass. Pours translucent brown with small beige head. Nice strawberry aroma, medium body, medium carbonation, and good small bubble lacing. Taste is fruity, sweet/tart strawberry, and some rhubarb.  I like several of there other fruit beers better (apple ale, Belgian Red, Serendipity, and Raspberry tart), but still a very good beer.
Slightly tangy lush strawberry flavor with some sparkle. Very refreshing with no bitter after taste.

Thnx to bobochamps 
Pours murky brown , no foam 
Smell is strawberry milk 
Good carbo , bit sour . Tastes like fruit yoghurt , very exactly that 

Dry , a bit .

750 ml bottle. Rating from notes. Pours a bright syrupy red with a small pink head. Big, bright strawberry aroma with pie crust, rhubarb, some jam and mild perceptible tartness. Flavor is delicious: mildly tart, with lots of fresh, delicious strawberry pie notes. Fairly sweet. Lightish bodied, slick palate, above average carbonation. Finishes tart and sweet. Again, another wonderful fruit beer from New Glarus.

Bottle shared by Dallas at Mikeys holiday bash, thanks 
Cloudy red/amber with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma of strawberry pie, flavors of strawberry and rhubarb pie 
A nice dessert beer, tasty

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 75cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, with strawberries and rhubarb, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex fruit brew, fruity/sour and slightly sweet/woody, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, small head, good brew, yet expensive!

750 ml bottle from Timfoolery, strawberry big time, more juice than beer. Tastes good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Boy do these guys know their fruit beers. Poured a murky brownish color with aromas of jam, strawberry and rhubarb. Flavors are the same light tartness reminded me of a mild pie filling. Nice beer overall.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of TheAlum. Thanks Adam! Pours a murky orangish brown appearance with a brown head and pretty good retention. Not surprisingly, the aroma is a massive tart and sweet strawberry pie scent. Very seedy strawberry and pungent fruity aroma. Somewhat goopy and slightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor is fairly tart, moderately sweet, rich strawberry, light raspberry, somewhat woody/vanilla, very fruity flavor that finishes somewhat funky, tart, and very fruity. Almost purée like flavor. Pretty tasty in a small glass, but Im guessing Ill be a bit sick of it by the end of drinking the 750 by myself.

Murky red brown pour. Aroma is flavorful strawberry. The taste is strawberry rhubarb pie. It has a nice authentic fruit flavor. Very sweet, but slightly tart finish to balance. Medium carbonation and makes it real drinkable.

Bottle. Oh wow, this thing is fruity! Not too surpisingly coming from NG. Brownish hued color. White head. Strong aroma of strawberry upfront. Flavor is like eating a strawberry rhubarb pie. Sweet. Drinks very easy. Good but only in smallish portions.
Gorgeous color and flavor. If this beer is lacking in any respect, it would be in aroma. Like Serendipity, it's a bit sweet, though there is plenty of tartness that balances it out more effectively.

Bottle purchased from the brewery. Pours a nice dark cloudy brown, surprisingly. Smells and tastes pretty much as youd expect - heavy on the strawberry. The rhubarb really shines in the flavor - this is not overly sweet and has a nice tart flavor. This really does taste like a pie.

2013-11-15. Hazy dark amber body with a small foamy tan head. 3+ Aroma is lovely, sweet fruity strawberry. Flavour is quite fruity up front, with an interesting finish that has a sort of earthy vaguely spicey character to it. 7+ Very smooth. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Very interesting, pretty nice stuff. Bottle shared by JoeMcPhee

750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy reddish copper hue, very hazy, a medium white head. A rich bouquet of strawberries in the nose. The flavor mirrors this with massive sweet natural strawberry, a light tartness that might be rhubarb. Just awesome as usual. Super drinkable. Whats the ABV on this? 1%? Not getting a ton of rhubarb and maybe I wouldnt notice it at all without the suggestion. Lovely soft palate.

750 mL bottle. Cloudy amber in appearance with a decent sized off-white head. Aroma is of sweet strawberry jam, light tarness, caramel, rhubarb, and light lemon. Taste is of straeberry preserves, tart, rhubarb and granny smith apples.
Bottle. Clear but muddy look. The smell is strawberry, fruit, straightforward, leather, sweet, just a little tartness. The taste is sweet pretty much the same as the smell a little more tartness.
Pours pinkish hue with light pink head. Aroma is sweet and fruity with some light tartness. Flavors of sweet fruit and some light tartness. This was easy drinking and a crowd pleaser.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours murky brown with an off-white head. Aroma of a lot of strawberries, some rhubarb, some caramel and pale malts, and light fruits. Flavor the same. Average texture. A good fruit beer.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, shared with the wife. Hazy orange pour with fluffy and lacing off white head, aroma brought notes of big fresh strawberry, strawberry seeds, hints of flesh into some sweet vanilla, slight earthy and sweet caramel, nice lemony notes as well. Taste is a mix of lemon, nice strawberry, seeds and flesh, touch of earth, slight grassy notes into some earth, finishing fairly sweet, slightly tart, dry. Delicious.

What a nice fruit beer. Not normally a fan of fruit beers but this is an exception.

Has a very sweet strawberry smell that I was expecting. Pours a nice brown with a small white head. Has a very sweet taste at first that then becomes tart.

750 ml bottle poured a cloudy amber with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of bread, strawberry, rhubarb and vanilla. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a lightly tart finish. Flavors of bread, strawberry, vanilla and light rhubarb with a smooth lightly tart lingering jammy strawberry finish.

Thanks Adam for sending this my way. I hear it runs $9 in Wisconsin. I could easily use a case of this to drink early and often. Split with my Gf

A - Looks pretty disgusting. Reddish pink hues, force carbed carbonation. Very murky.

S - Nose is all strawberries. Smells like strawberry capri-sun juice. 

T - Sweet candies, gummy bears, strawberries and chalky enamel stripping rhubarb tartness. Very nice. Not sour, just sweet, fruity and tart. I could drink this whole bottle.

M - Jammy and jelly-like, medium body, goes down easy but sweetness lasts for a long time.

O - This is my favorite fruit beer from New Glarus. Very cool! Id love a case of this. Seriously.

A gift from my sister-in-law. Deep ruddy red pour. The aroma is loaded with strawberry and some intense fresh fruity aroma. A bit of soft peppery aroma and a touch of lactic character and a softly milky character. A nice chewy character and a bit of light tartness. Like bottled strawberry juice. Awesome stuff. Really fruity and intense and delicious.

Pour is brown with some slight pink/red tints throughout. Finger-wide head that fades quickly, nice lacing. Aroma is of strawberry jam and some sour funk. Flavor is a bit acidic at first and transitions into sweet strawberry jelly. Tart finish, light carbonation.
bottle at Gene McCarthys. cloudy pinkness pour. way too fruit jammy for me. Im sure therre are plenty who love tuts, as there were tonight. too jammy, fruity, jelly like for me

750ml bottle, courtesy of New Glarus. Thanks! Two-prong review. Dense, lush strawberry jam in the everything: fresh strawberries and fruit leather throughout; bright, forward fruit character. There is increased viscosity here as well, adding to the jam-like feel; overall a touch too heavy to drink this by the pint, but really nice stuff in small sips.
Bottle - The best strawberry jam. Cloudy copper with a rich beige head. Fruity acidic strawberry with a lacto creaminess and a creamy berry finish. Weird and wonderful.

Bottle. Pours a murky amber brown color with off white head. Strawberry, rhubarb pie aromas. Tangy, strawberry, fruity flavors. Quite sweet, tart, and tangy. Not my favorite of the New Glarus fruit beers, but still better than the majority of fruit beers.

Pours a nice cloudy brown, smells of sweet sweet strawberry. Slightly sour smelling, tastes more of the same but SWEET, SWEET strawberry. Tastes like beer and berry juice, not enough in the sour department. Not terrible but too damn sweet and juice-like.

---Rated via my tastebuds and my brain.

bottle. basically the same as the other fruit beers from NG, the fruit character is spot on and huge, but residual sweetness is very high and is very cloying. after an ounce my stomach couldnt really take all the sugar. nice tannin structure helps but ultimately I could only drink a few ounces and is thus will hurt the score. Great beer split many ways or at a festival.

Rose-amber with good, creamy, pink head, light lacing / Sweet nose of fresh strawberry, perfume, cream / Medium body, creamy, sweet and lightly tart, nicely balanced with no cloying character / Simple, but fresh and delicate flavors of strawberry, cream, with notes of celery/rhubarb / Very nice, in this simple, fresh style.
Amber to mahogany body, offwhite head. Aroma has strawberry fudge, jelly and some sweet maltiness almost like sugar. Flavour is pancakes with strawberry jelly. Way too sweet.

750, capped. Thanks, C! Damn. Pours a clear ruby with light frothy pink head that settles quickly. Gorgeous sweet fresh fruit nose, truly smells like a glass of perfectly ripe freshly cut berries. Rhubarb shows well as a complement to the sweet berry notes, but no bitterness or tannic overtone. Bubbly light body. More gorgeous sweet fresh berries on the mid-palate with a great balance from rhubarb; just enough to mitigate any sticky or cloying qualities without adding any huskiness or bitterness. Refreshing but still rather sweet finish. Wonderful stuff.

bottle thanks to wes. cloudy dark amber with a small head. big strawberry sweet aroma. nice sweet strawberry flavors with a hint of bitter seed. refreshing palate with a medium body. nice fitting sweetness. not really sour at all which is a plus for me, but a hint of tart would be nice too. honestly, probably one of the best fruit beers ive ever had.
Pour is super haze. Nose is explosive fresh fruits, tart strawberry, fruit skins. Flavor is again fresh fruits, sweet and tart. Like pour juice. spritzy carbonation. lovely.

10/13/13. 750mL bottle shared by Matt and Adam! Reddish pink pour with a small pink head. Sweet aroma, lots of strawberry, reminds of candy or jam. Lightly tart flavor, more strawberry jam, rhubarb pie aspect pops through a touch more. Interesting, tasty.

What can I say. New Glarus rocks balls at Fruit Beer. Pours a red-pinkish with a medium pinkish head. Aroma is like strawberry jelly. Taste is sweet, slightly tart, good strawberry and rhubarb flavors. Outstanding.

Nice color almost like a red grape. Scent of strawberries bursting out of the glass and a touch of rhubarb in the background. Better than Serendipity mostly because it is more tart and less sweet than Serendipity. Thats why I enjoyed the anniversary brew they made this summer so much because it was like serendipity without the sugar. If they didnt tell me I wouldnt think it had any alcohol in it. Truly a world class fruit beer. This would make a great sorbet.
Bottle. Nose is strawberry jelly. Very sweet. Taste is also very sweet. Tastes too much like juice for my liking. Just not my thing.

Bottle thanks to fear025. Pours an unappealing brownish orangey red, slightly cloudy. Aroma is of smashed strawberries like sweet sweet strawberry jam. The taste is tart and gives you that slight phlegm in the back of your throat. Very effervescent and fruity. Medium to light bodied.
Bottle in line for West Ashley. Aroma and flavor is strawberry rhubarb pie filling. Holy shit this is amazing! Love this beer!

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured hazy orange color an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Medium to heavy strawberry tart fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a tingly texture and soft carbonation. Solid complex dark sweet and tart fruity flavor with a medium tart & sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Standout drinkable fruit beer.

750 ml bottle shared by b3shine. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have a slightly tart, big sticky fruity, malty. Ill update soon, but this is another solid fruit beer from NG.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2013 750 ml bottle to taster (shared by me with the group; thanks tastybeer). Looks good; a cloudy light copperish orange with foamy off-white lacing. Smells solid; strawberry first and rhubarb second. Tastes like it smells, only more robust and a bit sweeter, with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. This is good beer!

750 ml bottle. (New Glarus Brewery) New Glarus, WI. HHOK XV.
Clear or hazy red... strange colour... with small foamy greyish reddish tan head. Pie, apple, strawberry jam, strawberries, cherries and tartness in a wild aroma. Strawberry jam, tartness, pancakes, sweetness and apple in the flavour. Very interesting. Maybe a little bit too sweet.
Freaking delicious strawberry rhubarb pie aroma and flavor! Medium to light body, the perfect hint of tartness, a really well rounded fruit beer. In my top five for the year so far. Yum!

The beer appears mildly hazy and a grapefruit pinkish color. The aroma is classic New Glarus. Sweet and fresh fruit abounds. Teeming with strawberry and rhubarb, akin to a homemade pie. Just delicious. Quite possibly the best beer I have had from this brewery. As with other beers of this ilk, I prefer to enjoy in small quantities, as the sweetness can become cloying. Overall, this was fantastic.

Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours a hazy, dark orange with some white head. Nose has a lot of berry, tons of rhubarb, grass, strawberry. Flavor is sweet, strawberry candy, lightly tart, rhubarb, earthy. Sweet finish. Loads of flavor. Loved this.

Pours hazy red. Aroma of strawberry, pie crust, and some apple cider. Flavor is literally strawberry rhubarb pie! Flavors are well rounded, with a little bite on the end. A fantastic beer!

Wow a burst of strawberry.... rhubarb comes in in taste, light tartness. Usual new glarus sugary sweet fruity, abundance of strawberry. Very good but cant drink more than a glass

750 ml bottle. A murky medium amber beer, with a large, frothy, lacing, mostly lasting off-white to pinkish head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted bread), with a very strong note of strawberry (puree, bubblegum, etc.) and a note of rhubarb. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, moderately acidic. Medium body, velvety/syrupy texture, average/lively carbonation, pretty long finish with light bitterness. An odd one, maybe because its my first attempt with a New Glarus fruit beer. I can say the aroma is outstanding, not complex and multi-dimensional, but simply 100% enjoyable. Pretty sweet taste, and strange, almost syrupy mouthfeel. Strawberry shines from the beginning to the end, rhubarb comes out after a few sips/sniffs and its a great accompaniment. Would love to retry it.

Bottle. Tasty stuff. strawberry all over the nose and flavor. Light tartness from the rhubarb but the strawberry definitely takes center stage. Sweet, but not fake tasting at all, almost like strawberry purée. Another impressive fruit beer from Dan Carey.

25 oz bottle.

Aroma of strawberry rhubarb pie with a light sour yogurt funkiness. Super hazy lightly red copper pour with actually a decent lace. Not as sweet as their other fruit beers to my taste, and a more significant tart bite on the finish. Palate is fairly carbonated, slightly sticky and medium-thin. Probably my favorite of the NG fruit beers in the big bottles.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Very fresh and tart fruity aroma. Strawberry, rhubarb pie, medium sourness. Very tasty and refreshing.
Pours light orange with a white head. The aroma is strawberry forward with a rhubarb finish. Sweet, but less so than serendipity,rt a d belgian red
UPDATED: OCT 14, 2013 Bottle at GABF. Pours dark amber with white head. Nose and taste of fresh ripe strawberry, rhubarb pie, passionfruit and juice. Medium body. Delightful.
Pours a hazy copper with a thick off white head. Aroma and flavors if rhubarb pie with a scoop of strawberry ice cream. Sweet but not cloying. Moderate carbonation. Smooth sweet finish.

Bottle: &nbsp Dark dirty, deep amber. &nbsp Large frothy beige head, nice lacing. &nbsp Whoa! &nbsp Strong strawberry tootsie roll aroma. &nbsp Sweet, candyish, and strawberry in the candyish sense. &nbsp Lordy, sweet, strawberry, some tootsie roll, very much like the candy Mamba, the German Starburst. &nbsp Dialing in there is a bit of Rhubarb as well. &nbsp Sweet, very realistic and flavorful. &nbsp Lots of fruit beers are very artificial, but New Glarus just kicks the piss out of everything in that they come across as very natural. &nbsp This is no exception. &nbsp Lingering Strawberry, Rhubarb, and Tootsie Roll. &nbsp Fruity and candyish, absolutely well put together, not to be separated, and unified to create one of the greatest Fruit Beers out there. &nbdp New Glarus has this market cornered, and forever will. &nbsp Real, fresh, and authentic. &nbsp Not many brewers can do a Fruit Beer with those three words. &nbsp Thank you Bob!

Hazy reddish amber pour with a thin creamy off white head and lots of light sticky lacing .... aroma of mostly sugary strawberries and some caramel malt with rhubarb appearing as it warms  .... taste is of sugary strawberries, tart rhubarb, has some jam qualities to it ... def has nice body to it with a light lively carbonation ..... lightly acidic with a dry tart finish ... delicious but a tier under their other stuff

ours a nice light red strawberry red. The nose on this beer is amazing! Like fresh pressed strawbeery jam, sweet and sugary. This one starts of with a nice quick tart punch from the rhubarb, fallowed by the sweet juicy strawberries. The flavors compliment eachother amazingly. Almost like drinking a strawberry fruit roll up! Has a slighly filling mouth feel, def one to share with your lady friend! Overall another fruit beer homerun from New Glarus!

New Glarus is great all around, but theyve become the go-to fruit beer brewery in particular. On the same level at the raspberry and cherry. Sweet, but not overly so, ends dry. Ruby red and delicious.

Huge thanks to mverity! Pours a murky pinkish red. You can smell the freshness of the strawberries used. Very natural and aromatic. Both the strawberry and rhubarb aroma is there with hints of the malt, almost making it pie like aroma. Taste is abundance of strawberry and rhubarb, Fresh! Again the malt taste is there slightly adding a pie crust taste. The beer is sweet but not cloying and finishes dry. I would love to drink this all the time for dessert or outside at a picnic. Actually i could drink this a lot of places. Only negatives I can give it is that its almost more fruit juice than beer, but with flavors like this its hard to complain too much.
Aroma is heavy on the sweet rhubarb and strawberry. Taste mildly tart with the rhubarb and strawberry really shining. Nice cloudy brown color. Really really liking this beer.

Reviewed from memory of 10/5 bottle share. Big thanks to Lukaduke for sharing this bottle. Nose is huge strawberry rhubarb pie, fruity. Smells amazing. Taste is liquid strawberries, jam, rhubarb. Finish is very sweet. The fruitiest beer Ive ever tried!

Bottle. The pour is a murky reddish. The aroma is all strawberry. The taste is also heavy strawberry. A solid fruit beer.

Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Cloudy red/amber - offwhite head. High strawberry, fresh strawberry, light rhubarb aroma, rødgrød - no cream, light acid in the taste, rhubarb taste, light artificial strawberry in the taste. Nice but not that complex.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 From a bomber. Ugly cloudy brown. Very nice. The strawberry flavor is delicious, sweet without being cloying. Nice acidity, not as sour or funky as raspberry tart, I could drink this more often.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear orange-red coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and strawberries.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of caramel and strawberries.
Sweet finish.

Bottle at Yespr. Pours light amber with a small off-white head. Quite sweet with aromas of vanilla, strawberry and some rhubarb. Also hints of perfume. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Dry, fruity finish. Bit too sweet.

Bottle. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. aroma. Sweetness, strawberry, rhubarb, some sourness and vague citurs. flavour. full of strawberry, rhubarb, light sourness, some sweetness. spice. medium to full bodied. ends sweet with a ligh acidic touch.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a yellowish head. The aroma is dominated by strawberries. The flavor is sweet with notes of strawberries and malt, leading to a dry fnish.

75 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is smooth fruity. Solid strawberry. Candy, sugarish. Sweet and light toasted malty underneath. Citric rhubarb. Lingering fruity and mild citric. Lingering fruity into the finish. Green apple-ish.

Aroma is strawberries, (assuming) rhubarb, medium sweetness and cake-like malts. The flavor is strawberry, slight mustiness, mild funk, malts and a mix of berry cake and strong tartness in the finish. Its hard to go wrong with a NG fruit beer.

Bottle murky brownish light amber, color of apple cider. Nose some acidic tartness followed by strawberry cheesecake. Taste tart upfront fading into strawberry jam. Fairly creamy mouthfeel for the style. Not very pretty, but sure tastes better than it looks.

Murky red-brown body, large off-white head, spotty lacing. Intense strawberry, some lactic notes, and earthy rhubarb. Medium to light bodied, moderate sweetness and acidity. Lively carbonation. Another winner from New Glaruss fruit beer program.

750 ml green waxed bottle served in a stemmed wine glass. Enjoyed 7/20/13.

A: Pours a murky brownish color with some red tints to it. An off-white head forms on the pour and recedes to a thin ring. Mild lace.

S: Fresh squeezed strawberry with a nice oaky profile to it. There is a light spice from the rhubarb. A little stemmy and pithy as well.

T: Same as the nose. Lots of freshy strawberry juice with a little sweetness and tartness to it all at the same time. Light oaky profile with some malty breadiness that provides even more sweetness, but in a different way. Nicely cuts the juiciness and fruitiness from strawberry. Light touches of spiced rhubarb.

M: Extremely drinkable. Light bodied with a fruity and sweet finish. Light and airy mouthfeel.

O: As with all New Glarus fruit beers this one is dangerously drinkable as it borders on a nice fruity juice. Nice balance of fruitiness and sweetness. Extremely fresh and juicy. Would enjoy again.

Serving type: bottle

09-05-2013

Bottle. Pink brown colour, little head. Aroma is strawberry cheesecake, bit funky, some citrus, sweet. Taste is great. All fruit beers should be like this. Bit sour from rhubarb, good strawberry sweetness. Creamy but still a bit tart. Really nice. Texture like a lambic. Initial sourness then goes into strawberry cheesecake. Best beer of the day by miles.
Bottle. Strawberry and cherry with a good dose of apple. Not usually a fan of fruit beers, but Im really diggin this one. Very good.

Bottle shared by Adam at my wedding, thanks! Pours a cloudy deep ruby red with a pink hue and a pink head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has tuns of rhubarb and sweet strawberry throughout. Flavor has sweet rhubarb and strawberry up front that has a bit of tartness for balance in the finish.

Bottle while camping. Pours cloudy brown with a medium somewhat fizzy head. Aroma is fruity, strawberries prominent, with some lactic tartness present. Flavor is sweet and a bit of tart, strawberry with just a touch of that rhubarb flavor I remember best from my moms pies as a kid. Quite good as a desert sipper, and every bit as good as the rest of the NG fruit beer lineup.
Bomber. Hazy brown with a small head. Smells like strawberry jam. Strawberry and tart.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of huge strawberries and little else. It pours a cloudy orangish-brown with a small off-white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy sweet strawberry. The finish has light tart strawberry and lemon. Its medium bodied mild with moderate carbonation. Overall, its every bit the quality of other New Glarus fruit beers. My rating is more of a representation of my liking for strawberries.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Jeff! Muddled, swampy brown, almost completely opaque with barely a head; off white film. Aroma is deliciously fruity. Not sure what rhubarb smells like, but this is "berry" centric, with lots and lots of strawberry; light tartness and delicate residual sweetness. Taste is like juice; strawberry juice with light jam notes, sugary sweetness, and only the mildest tartness in the very back. Thin bodied, tight carbonation. Though far from my favorite NG fruit beer, still pretty solid all around.
Update: Bumping up my rating of this; more recent bottles that Ive opened have had a larger rhubarb character with the strawberry shifting towards more of an undercurrent/periphery role, essentially giving the beer a brighter, zesty tartness throughout & toning down the sweetness from the first, most fresh batches I had. Definitely coming into its own.

25 oz bottle. Cloudy brown with garnet tints and a lacy head. Nose is strawberry preserves and faint celery, rhubarb. Lively, spritzy and juicy medium body; tart and refreshing. Taste is strawberry and sour raspberry fading to lemon pith and earthy rhubarb. Great showcase for the strawberrys even if a bit too sweet and one-dimensional.

Pours a murky, muddled pink/orange/brown with a medium fluffy off white head. Smell is sweet fresh strawberries, light maltiness, more strawberries, and other sweet/tart berries. Taste is a good balance of sweet and tart strawberries, tart apples, light malt Nice body to this 4%er which I guess is from the rhubarb. Just goes to show what simplicity can do for a small beer with big flavor. Just love the light fresh tartness of this brew.

Pours a cloudy brownish rust color with a finger or two of gaseous eggshell foam. Aromas are fruit heavy with bits of strawberry, apple cider, cherry and a bit of cranberry too. The palate follows the nose with big juicy berry notes, structured with rhubarb tartness and a bit of a tannic background to balance out the sweetness. Rich full mouthfeel with a medium carbonation level. Long fruity finish.

750 ml bottle thanks to khoffman43. Pours a cloudy brown/red color with a small foamy that fades to a thick ring. Aroma is strawberries and green apples. Im not familiar with rhubarb too much, does it smell/taste like green apples? Taste is juicy fresh apples and strawberries. This one is definitely the most tart New Glarus fruit beer Ive had but its still less tart than the average sour beer. Love the soft bubbly carbonation. Overall, another great fruit beer from New Glarus but my least favorite so far.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Pours a hazy brown/red with a fair off-white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is full of ripe strawberries, might be the most potent strawberry aroma I have ever encountered (strawberry jam does not smell that much!). Taste is heavily sweet but there is also a nice tartness that prevent it from being too cloying (it is still plenty, though). Some nice apple juice flavors in there too. Carbonation level was kinda low and mouthfeel was sticky/sirupy. On the same level as Raspberry Tart and just a touch lighter/less sweet. Not bad (I enjoyed it), but why package that in a 750er?! 25cl bottles would be the perfect size to split over dessert...

pours muddy and dirty pale golden greyish with a frothy and bubbly off-white head, good retention and nice lacing (bottle was shaken a bit before, thanks to tom10101, my brah). intense sweet straberry purée, tartness in background, but not enough. strawberry jam, low but appreciable phenols, hint of vanilla, light acetic notes. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily, sticky and cloying, unbalanced sweet and lightly acidic finish. a sipper.. popsicles anyone?

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy dark copper with low beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of strawberries jam (intense), sugar, slight tartness. Taste is of strawberrie jam, sweet, slight acetic. Palate: Medium bodied. Somewhat sticky. Overall: Sugar is overwhelming. Nearly cloying. Looks like there is not enough rhubarb action here. Or too much sugar. Still enjoyable.

Bottle (750 ml). From AlexFields, thanks! Muddy brown (the bottle was shaken not too long before) with a medium off-white head, good retention, and good lacing. Aroma is mostly of strawberry jam with mild tartness and the usual gummies presence of New Glarus fruit beers. Taste is heavily sweet with a ton of strawberry jam, mild tartness and acidity and gummies. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation Sirupy. This is another less than 5% abv sipper from New Glarus. Very tasty, but with cloying sweetness.
Pours cloudy pink with a small pink head leaving some lacing. Amazing sweet sourish strawberry astringent as is flavor. Longlived strawberry sweet finish

This one poured a Ruby red color with a pinkish head. Aroma was all straight strawberries, light tartness probably rhubarb. Flavor was similar, good mix of tart and sweet, all strawberries and then a light Beery finish
 Another excellent fruit beer from New Glarus.

Bottle from Casanovas, light hazy amber pour with a thin white head. Aroma of sweet strawberry jam, rhubarb tartness and a little funk. Taste is similar, strawberry very up front almost like eating straight jelly. On the border of being too sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
September 2, 2013 - bottle shared by Brandon. Dirty dishwater pour with some head and spotty lacing. Aroma was big time strawberry. Taste was like a strawberry rhubarb pie.

Thanks to Michael for this one. Pours a brilliant Bud Lite Lime Straw-ber-ita color. Aroma is heavy stewed strawberries, tending toward sweet preserves, with a hint of earthiness. Flavor is identical to those little individually wrapped strawberry candies, the ones where the wrapper is red and green. Thats pretty cool.

Guest tap at Vintage (Madison)

Since this was available as a draft line I decided to give it a shot before delving into some of the local offerings. I am glad I did because both in the bottle and keg this is a delicious fruit beer. Nothing short of rhubarb pie in a glass it is a fine addition to the New Glarus family.

Aroma / Appearance - A reddish base looks like someone whipped up a bloody mary then tossed on a rich head. Strawberry rhubarb pie tickles the senses along with a very subtle sourness. This is almost like candy in a glass but unlike sweetened lambics works because it has no pretensions of being anything but.

Flavor / Palate - The strawberries and rhubarbs also are strong in each sip. A mild sour tang is more salty than vinegar. Far too easy to drink in just a couple of gulps this beer is fantastic from the time it gets to you to the last drop. If passing through Wisconsin pick up a couple.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2013 Poured hazy red pink with a little cream head. Light strawberry aroma. Tastes like a creamy strawbeery tart yogurt. Quite smooth. Would be surprised to know it had any alcohol in it.

Woah. This was great. Aroma is pure strawberry jam. Go Smuck yourself. Pours a nice white head over top of a cloudy reddish/brown body. It looks like there is a ton of fruit in there. Taste, again, is just straight up strawberry jam. Not overly sweet but on the sweet side. Refreshing, tasty, satisfying on many levels. Too good.

A steady pour into my New Belgium globe glass produces a two finger thick, light tan colored head that seems to be quite creamy textured; as I drink the beer it leaves quite a bit of layered lacing on the sides of my glass. The beer is a dark, plum-red color that shows a brilliantly clear, bright, gold-tinged, red hue when held up to the light. The nose smells brightly of strawberries, like a concentrate, coulis of strawberries. There is perhaps an earthiness here that suggests at the malt from the base beer here, and there is also a touch of tartness to the aroma.

As expected the beer is sweet, though not quite as cloying as I was dreading. The strawberry flavors play the dominant role in the flavor to, though it is not quite as dominant as it is in the nose. There is prickly carbonation to the beer, which helps to offset the richness of the body; this definitely sits on the palate quite a bit, it is quite chewy textured, but it is still drinkable enough. Trying to reach for a sense of the base beer here, it is quite hard though, perhaps a touch of almost nutty, malt character, though you really have to dig for this. The beer has a soft tartness to it that melds with the strawberry character; I dont really get a sense of the rhubarb, but that is always the case with this kind of combination.

In the same vein as the other Fruit beers from New Glarus, sweet, fruity, without much beer character to it. If that is what you are looking for these can definitely hit the spot, and can certainly be enjoyable as such.

Bottle pours a slightly hazy reddish orange with a large pinkish khaki head. Aroma of strawberry yogurt. Taste similar to aroma sweet strawberry yogurt with some tart rhubarb, strawberry dominating. This pretty good, but not nearly as much as other New Glarus fruit beers.

750mL pouring at Hermosillo Club. Clear orange like pour with medium white foam. Nose is rich strawberry dessert with crust, whipped cream, shortcake. Taste is sweet with shortcake, some lactic acid bite, and some of that butteriness that is present in their other fruit beers that creates an oily thickness. Great palate even if a bit slick. Comes across more dessert like.

Bomber from Brook Falls Discount shared with Eric & Randy & Laura. (Randy didnt like, Laura loved) Pours quite reddish with some pink and little head. Aroma has fresh strawberries and fruit jam and faint oak. Taste is sweet strawberries, just slightly tart and a bit gummy, with a bit of earthiness. Too sweet to drink much of. Not NGs best fruit beer.

Draft at The Old Fashioned. Pours murky red-brown, with minimal head. Sweet strawberry aroma and ... is that rhubarb? Smells like what it claims to be, I guess. Nice sweet, tart strawberry on the tongue with rhubarb coming through beautifully in the lingering aftertaste. Like drinking a strawberry-rhubarb pie beer. Light body, average carbonation. Very drinkable -- the only thing keeping me from drinking this all night long is its sweetness (would become a bit much after 2-3 pints) and my ridiculous drive to rate more beers. Im a fool. This beer is great.

750 ml. bottle. It pours a muddy light brown with some orange. Off white head. The aroma is super powerful strawberries. Pretty much ice cream sundae strawberry syrup topping. In fact, exactly like that. Distant, vague maltiness. The flavor is more of the same. Amazing authentic fruit character almost syrupy but stopping just short of being too sweet and cloying. Typical New Glarus. This is probably the most authentic strawberry character Ive ever had in a beer. You can argue about its merits based on BJCP style guidelines, but this is such a treat and change of pace from the other tics out there. Loved it.
Bottle. Cloudy amber brown color. Nice aroma of fresh strawberries, wow! Taste is fruity, plenty of berries.

Bottle shared with Linh, Pat, Andrew and Brendan. Pours a deep reddish body with light off white lacing. Aroma is as if you opened a fresh jar of strawberry jam. Incredible and super seedy. Mouthfeel is soft and sweet with great notes of strawberry jam dominating, light sour flavor, cherries and a nice subtle tart character. Another wonderful fruit beer from the masters at New Glarus.

From a 750ml bottle. This one poured a vibrant, bright red color with a pink head. Aroma was quite a bit like fresh strawberries. This was pretty damn good and really enjoyed this one. So much strawberry. It reminds me of eating a strawberry rhubarb pie, though it was a bit light on the rhubarb unfortunately. At ~7%, this wasnt a booze bomb, and made it highly, and dangerously drinkable. Very crisp, very refreshing.
Very nice strawberry fruit beer, a little sour, grassy, citrus, herbs, overall very good.

Pours dark pinkish red. Smell is off strawberry and the taste is the same. Palate has a nice thickness too it. Flavor was drowned out a little bit by some of the carbonation, but all in all NG clearly knows what it is doing with their fruit beers. Well done.

Pours a bright pink/red. This is full of strawberry. I mean jam packed. Its like a daiquiri without the booze. A bit of sour and a lot of sweetness. Overall really tasty, but i still think i like the other 3 fruits a bit better.
Bottle. Pink ruby pour with some white head. Seems like fresh strawberry aroma. Mostly sweet with a touch of tart strawberry tones. Not a huge fan but strawberry fans would love this.
Bottle w James Andy Pat at James. Dark glassy red. Aroma is gooey red fruit juices. Tastes much the same. Viscous, chewy mouthfeel. Like a gusher but not as tart or sharp.

Bottle shared by James with me, Andrew and Brendan. Pours pinkish maroon with a thin, creamy off-white head. Aroma of Welch's strawberry fruit snacks. Palate is thin and juicy, with a ton of strawberry fruit snack flavor. This is just amazing.
