750 bottle. Pours light copper/brown. Huge fruity nose. Big strawberry flavors and goes down so easy. Truly delicious.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Aromatics are straight strawberry pez, not much else has going on. Appearance is nice deep ruby/ brown. Taste is super sweet up front and on the backend... In the middle sme mild odd bitterness, I am assuming from the bitter rhubarb. Not bad but wish it was slightly less sweet. Palate is great and smooth. Overall, not my favorite of this style fron NG..... But still good.

Pours a hazy yellow brown with a paper thin head. Aroma of strawberry, that's all. Taste is strawberry, and that's all I'm getting, great beer with strawberries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A couple small pours at the 2013 Great Taste in Madison. Hazy, faded orange with a big layer of white foam on top. It really puts off the strawberry aroma and smells like a frosted red velvet cupcake with earthy, subdued tartness and bready sourdough in the background. The taste is a delicious blend of strawberry rhubarb cake, biscuity shortbread Girl Scout cookies and mild, sweetened and ripened vegetables. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, fluffy foam that sticks around on top. Overall sweet, but not overly-so. Its definitely a dessert beer with a very distinct taste, and worthy of a whole pint after dinner.
Amazing strawberry nose. Straight strawberry rhubarb pie taste. Very sweet with nice carbonation. Slight bitterness on finish.

750ml bottle. I rated this one on tap, but am going to rate it now because I probably wont have that uploaded until 2014 some time. Very attractive thick red, hint of orange in there. Steady, patchy off-white head. The aroma is intensely sweet, deserty...big fruit tones..not really beerlike at all. Doesnt really taste like a beer when it comes down to it, all out strawberry on top of some earthy, tart rhubarb. Easy drinking, very pie like, another great addition to the NG fruit beer family. Raises the bar substantially for Strawberry beers, Ive never had one this pronounced. Excellent beverage.

Bottle pours medium yellow brown with one finger off-white head. Nice lacing. Strawberry aroma with a hint of sourness. Wonderful sweet taste of strawberries with just the right amount of rhubarb tartness and sugar. No medicinal flavors, tastes like the real deal. Thick juice like palate, almost a thin smoothie consistency. Finish lingering slight pleasant tartness. No discernible alcohol.

I am not big on fruit beers but man this was good.

Aroma of strawberries, slightly acidic, some brown sugar, and a little white grape juice. Pours a mahogany color with some pink highlights with a large, white, foamy head. Tastes of strawberries and sour cherries with an acidic edge. Really very close to strawberry rhubarb pie flavor. Delicious, sweet beer.

Dirty orange pour that looks like Rhubarb jam in color w/ a small white head and light lacing. Aroma is fruity earthy and sweet, more strawberry comes through here than anything but with a nice tang. Palate is pretty average. Flavor is great.. sweet strawberries in the front and a lightly tart tangy rhubarb in the finish. Overall I would characterise it at sweet, but not cloyingly so. Another amazing fruit offering from NG.

Bottle. Pours muddy, hazy brown. Tan head, some retention/good lace. Aroma of strawberry/rhubarb pie, fruit yeast. Taste is tart, sweet, rhubarb, strawberry, earthy. Palate is soft, slick, rich fruit finish.

Pours a medium ruddy brown with a 3 finger, creamy tan head that has great retention. Aroma is huge with the aroma of strawberry rhubarb pie, it really is unbelievable how well they recreated that amazing aroma. Maybe a bit light on the rhubarb, but Ill let it slide, because it smells amazing. Throw in some extra floral and fruity notes and some extra tartness, maybe a little lactic acid twinge. Flavor is full on strawberry rhubarb pie right up front, more rhubarb in the flavor than the aroma, complete with nice toasty flavors, a little vanilla, nice, sweet floral notes, lactose-like sweetness, a little toffee, cereal and a nice little extra tartness bringing up the finish. Medium, juicy body with a creamy entry, light, spritzy and blanketing carbonation and nice acidic tingle coming in midway. Fantastic all around. Another great fruit beer from New Glarus.

Draft at The Coopers Tavern in Madison, served in a tulip. Pours a hazy reddish brown, dull and earthy in color, with minimal head. Sweet strawberry nose with some sugary candy to it. The flavor starts with strawberries and rhubarb for a sweet, tart balance, and transitions into the mixed fruity character reminiscent of Serendipity; grape, apple, cranberry. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, fruity, refreshing mouthfeel. Delicious. Best strawberry beer Ive ever had.

Pours a murky brown/orange/red. Rich short head,thick light lace.
 Nice candy strawberry aroma with rhubarb.
 Good sweet strawberry/rhubarb taste with apple/pear.Full body.Not too tart,not sour,nice sweetness with just the right amount of mild tartness. Nice finish. Good stuff. Havent had too many fruit beers but this is pretty awesome. Glorious. New Glorious.
750 ml. bottle. Pours reddish brown with a nice white head. Aroma of strawberries and other fruits. Taste is tart strawberries, sweet strawberries, and other fruits. Delicious!
Really great jammy strawberry nose with a very light dash of nutty malts. The taste is huge strawberry candy and heavy sweetness but doesnt seem cloying somehow. Love it.

Bomber. Ruby brown pour with off white head. Some retention. Nose mainly of fresh strawberries maybe slight lemon. Taste is full of strawberries, and other fruit. Slight vegetable flavor as well.  Very mild acidity and finish more on the sweet side than dry. Another fabulous beer from NG. Killing it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big want, thanks Brad. Gorgeous pour! Strawberry jam, bright New Glarus yeast, rhubarb & apple also show through. Not sweet at all. Imminently sessionable, great body, and I cannot wait to have this again. ISO!

Sample from a 750ml bottle. Clear amber orange color. Good thin khaki head. Dots of lace. Awesome strawberry nose. Strawberry shortcake. Medium body. More crisp, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Moderate sweet, only lightly tart. Pretty delicious, sweet strawberry fruit beer.

Bottle shared. Pours a copper color with a white head of foam. The aroma is sweet strawberry jam and candies. Tastes more like sweet strawberry than anything else. I was hoping the rhubarb would come through a little more.
Deep red pour with a light pink head. Aroma is tart and strawberry fruit with a similar taste. Tart, sugar sweet and very good.

Very good and refreshing. Pours a purple reddish with a foamy white head. Aroma is strawberry and hint of some tart sweet tarts. Taste is like mashed up strawberries but not much tartness, more sweet. Was hoping for more rhubarb but still great stuff.

pours a murky amber/reddish color with a thick off-white head. aroma is fresh strawberries...almost like preserves...underlying vinous and tang notes. flavor is loaded with strawberry but not sweet...a tart note creeps in that is slightly vegetal and vinous (like slightly tart celery) in a good way (i dont have much experience with rhubarb). mouthfeel is light and lively with a nice vinous strawberry finish. damn tasty.

750 mL bottle brought back by my friend Nadjeeb from Wisconsin and shared with two other friends Mika and RBer Alraomon who helped me move. I thought this would be worthy to share with friends and to be the very first beer opened at my new apartment. Pours a hazy rust color with a medium sized frothy off-white head. Good head retention. Aroma of tart fruits, earth, grape, berries. The taste is grapes, rhubarb, berries, pale bready malts. Medium bodied and quite refreshing, which is exactly what we needed. And it just happens to be my 200th fruit beer. Cool!
Red pour, pink head. So this beer tastes just like a liquid strawberry rhubarb pie. Sweet and tart and delicious. Awesome.

Pours browish-red with a pink head. Aroma is like the strawberry-rhubarb pie my mom and grandma used to make and maybe some strawberry jam. Flavor is tart strawberry, sour, sweet. Another winner from NG.

Bottle with Ray. Pours brownish red with thin, bubbly, tan head and spotted lace. Nose of strawberry jam and berries. Tons of strawberry flavor, mild bitter and sourness, most sweet but balanced. Tasty as hell. Another great fruit beer from New Glarus

Bottle from Wrye. Thanks! Pours a muddy red with tan head. Aroma is strawberry jam, vanilla and some slight wild. Taste is overly ripe strawberry, vanilla initially and then some slight, slight tart to sour. The carb helps this. Probably rates right under Raspberry Tart in terms of the three big 750 NG beers. Great stuff though.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Reddish-brown pour with a tan head. Aroma is strawberry. Taste is strawberry, a little sour, and some musty notes. The strawberry dominates aroma and flavor. I dont really notice the rhubarb. I grow rhubarb in my backyard so I am accustomed to its distinct flavor. Nevertheless, this is one fine tasty beer that I am glad I bought a lot of it. Ok lacing.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Bomber. Murky orange amber pour. Smells exactly like my moms strawberry rhubarb jam. Smooth palate with good body. Sweet and tart flavor. Awesome.

Pours dark red lightly cloudy. Smells like a bowl of strawberries. Nice strawberry /rhubarb taste. Not too sweet. A little heavier on the tounge that some of the other New Glarus fruit beers. Overall excellent.

Bottle. Pours dark copper with a frothy white head. Aroma is slightly musty and funky with lots of tart strawberry. Taste is huge on strawberries, very tart and sweet. A little earthiness is present. Rhubarb is understated. Palate is medium mouthfeel. Round and slick with a slight carb. This is absolutely delicious.

New Glarus are the masters of the fruit beer, but that said, I have to say this one is something of a disappointment. Pours a reddish-brown with good-sized head. Sour strawberry aroma. Flavor is of fresh strawberries, tempered by a sour rhubarb. Maybe its just the flavor combination, but this one doesnt work for me and Ive been a fan of Serendipity and pretty much every other NG fruit beer Ive tried.

Bottle pour into a New Glarus footed pilsner glass. Decent amount of slightly rose head. Not as much carbonation as expected. Strong fruit aromas and taste. Malt is noticeable too. Tied with the cherry beer in my book.
Huge thanks to Matt for giving me this for my birthday, by favorite food flavor, man these guys make these taste just like fresh strawberries crushing it bros

750ml bottle. Poured an amber color with a reddish/pinkish tinge and a smaller sized head. Yum, fresh strawberries. Strawberry shortcake. New Glarus hits another one out of the park. Just all around great.

Pours cherry juice amber with a smaller white head. Aroma is soft sweet strawberries, almost strawberry cream. Flavor brings sweet strawberries with decent tang that falls off at the end. Body is just right, medium and juicy.

Bottle shared with a collection of heady brahs at Barrys. Nose is strawberry and raspberry jam, strawberry rhubarb pie, strawberry soda and some more berry. Flavor is tart strawberry shortcake, berry seeds, fruit rollup, butter, oak, candy straws and nectar. Medium to full body with subtle carbonation. There wasnt a person at the tasting that didnt love this fucking beer. New Glarus owns the fruit beer game, no one else even competes. Retardedly Good!

Bottle at home, courtesy of Eric. Thanks again man. Pour is murky amber with a big tan head and decent lacing. Big strawberry, raspberry, lightly tart, tannin, peachy, somewhat earthy, tangerines, and sweet rhubarb in the aroma. Taste is big strawberry, raspberry pit, pithy, orange juice, and sweet & sour fruits, yet theres this raw earthiness that cuts through the sweetness with the end result being very well-balanced with some light sour notes on the backend. Full mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Another amazing fruit beer from New Glarus.
Strawberry, sour, sweet. Very fresh tasting- like a strawberry purée was poured into Berliner Weiss. Awesome beer! Women love this beer.

Picked this up in Madison and took it to the north shore, enjoyed it while camping. What a delightful and thirst quenching beer for hanging out in the sun. It tasted like the best strawberry soda ever. I do wish the ABV was higher, but that may be asking too much. I hope they continue to make this one.

This beer pours a deep caramel/orange color with an intense foamy head that is both tall and dense with a light cream and pink color to it. Aroma is intense of strawberries with a light tang to it and a light wheat and light toasted malt to lend almost a a shortcake type of nose. Flavor has a lot of strawberry but the sweetness is definitely cut by both a light tartness imparted from the wild yeast and (I presume) the rhubarb. Balance in this beer is utterly fantastic. Body is slightly fizzy with a light/modest body. Overall one of the best beers I have ever had! The tartness which is doubled by the wild yeast and rhubarb is perfectly balanced by a fantastic strawberry sweetness. Honestly one of the most unique fruit beers out there.

Bottle. Deep pinkish brown with an off tan head. Nose is strongly of strawberries with some pie spice and brown sugar. Subtle vegetal rhubarb note. On tasting, creamy and modestly sweet. Faint metallic note and tartness. Clean and richly fruity with a creamy mouthfeel. Nice beer.

1 aug 2013, bottle. Orange/brown, a bit hazy. Nose is sweet strawberry jam. Thin/med body and mildly fizzy. Strawberry, bready malt. Strawberry doesn't taste as good as it smells. Ok.

750ml bottle thanks to Ghostface. pours a hazy red with foamy white head. big strawberry aroma. taste is the same big strawberry with slight tart. very drinkable
Strawberry jam. Big jammy strawberry rhubarb. Best strawberry presence in a beer. Cream. Great fruit character. Pretty great. Pleasant amount of Sweetness. Clean. Nice.

750 ml bottle picked up at Star Liquors (Madison, WI). Excited for a new member of the Fruit Family. Opened with the Mrs. Pours a well hazed brownish ruby hue, gentle orange glow, murky middle moves out to reddish copper glow on the bottom and edges. A frothy tannish head atop dies to a firm filmy layer, smaller filmy lacing and stick around. Aromas are medium strawberry fruit, a bit seedy, gentle tartness, berry, gentle brown malt. Touches of earth, rhubarb, mellow lemon and tartness. Strawberry lemonade of medium strength gives a good firm presence but not powerful. Initial is a bit more potent, medium bodied, perhaps lighter, some prominent strawberry, farm fresh with tart and seedy elements, some lemon, rhubarb, firm tartness strikes. A touch jammy but more tart, strikes quite the nice balance. Middle is a touch sweeter, some jam, brown malt middle, some gentle toastiness, earth, and biscuits. Jammy strawberry, seedy, less tart and a touch earthy. Backend is tart again, lemony, citrusy, strawberry lemonade. Almost a bit of acidity. Tart rhubarb, earth, a touch green and earthy. Dry and tart. Finish is tart, a touchs sticky. I must say, the body on this one is much lighter, more summery and crushable than the bit more brooding, cocoa and brown malt Serendipity. Tartness is at a good stronger level, lemony, tart, and just a touch sticky. I wouldnt say this particular beer is the most assertive or potent of the New Glarus fruit family, but its my favorite in flavor and palate. Nose could use a touch more intensity, its pretty nice as it settles but not as potent as some of the others. Very nice beer here.
Bottle. Pours is a murky red, nice head. Aroma is overwhelmingly strawberry. Flavor is strawberry, some tartness. Creamy, tart, fruity and awesome. Could ddrink this all day long.

This pours a reddish amber color with a fluffy cream colored head. There is a very strong aroma of strawberries. The taste is a sweet clash of strawberries and rhubarb. It basically reminded me of a strawberry fruit roll-up from when I was a kid only in a beer form. I dont see this having quite the hype as Belgian Red, Raspberry Tart, or Serendipity but its still quite good.

From the bottle thanks to ElGaucho! Fantastic pour out of the bottle with a big foamy pink head on a ruby fill. The aroma is very fruity and you get a ton of strawberries, but there is a bit metal scent left that is unfortunate. Taste is big strawberry jam and finishes with a slight tartness from the rhubarb (and I almost want more sour! Overall, a killer beer!

Bottle @ home shared by Jake. Bright red pour with minimal off-white head. Enormous strawberry jam nose. Sweet fruit, mild rhubarb, and light tartness. Tons and tons of strawberry flavor. Smuckers strawberry jam, slight rhubarb and bubblegum, and a subtle tartness.

Bottle thanks to khoffman43! Hazy reddish brown pour, small ring of medium carbonation and an aroma of fresh strawberries. Flavor is also nice strawberry, tempered by a little tart rhubarb and nice malt and a little biscuity. Really nice, hope to pick up another bottle or two of this if I can.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2017 Muddy brown color. Aroma of strawberries and tart rhubarb. Thus is an amazingly good beer. Sour, tart, fruity. One of the best of the New Glarus fruit beers I have had. If you see it, this is a must buy.---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone re rate for 2017 release

Magic in a bottle Dan knows his way around fruit beers. Slightly hazy reddish brown pour with a big white head. Nose is like snorting strawberry rhubarb jam. Tart, yet tamed by the strawberry. Excellent beer - hope to see it every summer!

Bottle. Pours muddy reddish brown, nice sudsy white head. Nose is juicy strawberry for days, a little tartness from the rhubarb, with a hint of lactic nature from the wild brown base. Follows the MO of the New Glarus beers: super fruity, a hint of sourness to prop it up. Creamy mouthfeel, like strawberry pie. Such a hard fruit to balance the sweetness of, and I feel like they mostly succeeded. Couldnt drink much though.

750 ml bottle shared with the wife. Pours unclear dark amber brown with a tight foamy sudsy khaki head that slowly settles to sudsy film and subtle lacing. Aroma has noticeable strawberry and tart sour scents with malt and I get the scent of cherry chapstick. Taste is pure strawberries that are tart with malt and the rhubarb is not really present to me, but damn it tastes good! Palate is medium fizzy carbonation and finishes dry. Really nice fruit beer!

Sample from a bomber from sherm1016. Thanks! Another fruit winner from New Glarus. Nose is the strawberry....but not too much. The rhubarb tart is in the taste and aftertaste. Not too sweet but definitely strawberry....wonderful on a steamy summer evening.
Stellar, smells like strawberry jam, flavor of strawberry rhubarb pie filling.

Ruby reddish pink apple juice body with large white head, lasting with lace. Effervescent. Wonderful aroma, soft and a little sour and acidic, strawberry, rhubarb, yeast - fruity and inviting. Crisp. perfectly balanced fruity sweet, tart, sour. Delicious and supremely drinkable.

very subtley sweet strawberry, tart, rhubarb.
Tastes so sweet yet light and refreshing. The perfect amount of strawberry and rhubarb, without being overpowering. Crisp and refreshing.

Pours hazy copper and red with some lacing white head. Aroma of sweet strawberry and tart rhubarb. Flavor is crisp sweet tart and finishes cleanly. Delicious tart beer. Wont quite call it a sour but overall delicious beer.

Bottle : I enjoyed the green wax on this bottle for some reason (Red/Green Color Combination for the Strawberry/ Rhubarb) : Pour is hazy golden brown with amber highlights in this glass, while revealing a moderate off white head here with average retention and mild lacing present. But you know the program - I doubt the base beer varies from the others ; the moral of the story is that you have yet another incredible flavor profile thanks to the strawberry rhubarb combo. The nose was a stunner on this one ; the combo comes through quite nicely - its robust and clear. There is more depth, with a solid earthy, musty note present. Again, it has a champagne style mouthfeel in a way, with a very prevalant fruit presence, nice malty backbone, and a lingering finish. I felt like the nose was the highlight here, but it still drank quite nicely (And yes, Raspberry still "wins" in my book)

750mL bottle. Poured clear medium raspberry with a pink-tinted head.. looked great! The aroma picked up semi-sweet strawberries paired with rhubarb and some funky, fruity yeast.. really nice strawberry and earthy character on the back of the nose.. tangy and engaging. The flavor opened with tart rhubarb and funky yeast, with strawberry seeds and light bready notes behind.. tart fruit skins, strawberry seeds, dry funk, and a kiss of champagne-like effervescence on the finish. Medium-bodied with high-ish carbonation on the palate.. moderate tartness-sourness the whole way.. dried out and was very refreshing on the finish.. great stuff!

Shared 750. Slightly hazy brown/orange with a hint of red. Absolutely intoxicating aroma of strawberries and cream. Tastes like strawberries with a little sour and zing. Another amazing fruit brew from NG.

Bottle. Pours to a hazy ruby brown body with a moderate foamy off-white head. The aroma is like a strawberry rhubarb pie and a light sour beer. The flavor is quite good. Definitely sweet strawberries, but it isnt sickly sweet. Theyre definitely balanced by a tart savory rhubarb and pie like component. Nearly like there is lactose sugar in this one to top it off with "ice cream". Very wholesome and like liquid pie. Rich palate, but not sickly sweet.
750-ml bottle from Tenutas, (quite) a step up from CVS. strawberry, balanced, not too tart, full body,

Orangish-brown pour with off-white head. Lots of carbonation. Nose is big, fresh, sweet strawberry and cream/vanilla, with a little tart rhubarb. Flavor sweet strawberry with softly tart rhubarb. Light vegetal/herbal notes from the rhubarb. Light, somewhat syrupy body. Fruit character is great, but too sweet. Not enough tart to balance. All-in-all another successful NG fruit beer, but best enjoyed in small quantities. Interesting to see what it would be like when the strawberry falls off a bit.

Bottle - Pours murky brown with a thin filmy light tan head. Nose is lots of fresh pie strawberries and pie filling, lighty soured malt, and a tiuch of tartness. Dont really get the rhubarb. Taste is a mix of strawberry sweetness and sour rhubarb, with the strawberry jelly of pie filling and a bit of crust. Finishes a bit sour and tart, but still pretty sweet. Soft and full in the mouth, with real nice carbonation. Not my favorite NG fruit beer, but its tasty.

750ml bottle from Brunos in Lake Geneva, split with the family. Pours a clear, reddish brown color with an off white head and some lacing. Aroma is fruity, strawberry. Medium on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, fruity, strawberry, light tartness, maybe some rhubarb, with a light strawberry finish. Reminds me of the Belgian Red moreso than the others. Another well made fruit beer from New Glarus.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 Full disclosure: I fucking LOVE rhubarb, and strawberry rhubarb pie is probably my favorite dessert of all time, so I am predisposed to love this beer - pours a medium red with a light haze and a thick, soapy lace - nose of sweet, fresh strawberry character, along with a balancing acidity, both from the rhubarb and the fermentation - there is also a mild, somewhat wild kind of funk to it - very fresh, summery aroma that showcases the fruit well - low carbonation, but very full in the mouth - bracing acid up front is followed by an explosion of sweet strawberry on the palate - mild funkiness follows, finishing with the light tang of the rhubarb and some closing acidity (lactic, even a touch acetic) that lingers on the palate - I quite like this, but again, I had a bias coming in - mmmm.

Poured from green waxed dipped 750ml purchased from the hilltop brewery, pours a hazy reddish brown with a really thin off white head and just a little bit of lacing, the aroma is of really fresh sweet strawberries right away but it kind of fades away into a little funkiness as well, the flavor much like the aroma has a forward amount of fresh picked strawberries with the tartness of the rhubarb in the finish, the finish is pretty dry, the more it warms the more tart and sour it gets, really starts to open up once it sits there a little bit. All around its solid and enjoyable, doesnt really hold up to Serendipity but it sure is drinkable. Well done.
